GameModel

Class Area

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameModel.Area
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Area
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    An Area is an area of the map which is sort of like a room, but not necessarily indoors. The Area contains occupants, an inventory, and possible exits. The room can also be sunny or not, which can effect certain mobs.
    Author:
    Matt Latura
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Area

        public Area(java.lang.String name,
    java.lang.String description)
        Construct a new Area and set the name and description. Construct a new ArrayList for the occupants and inventory.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Area.
        description - The description of the Area.

    • Method Detail

      • setSunny

        public void setSunny(boolean sunny,
            World w,
            Player p)
        The method will change the room to be a Sunny Room. Grue will not enter sunny rooms, and if they try to enter a room that is sunny, they will return to their original location.
        Parameters:
        sunny - True to set the room to sunny, false to set it to dark.
        w - The World that the Player is using the Sun Wand in.
        p - The Player using the Sun Wand.

      • isSunny

        public boolean isSunny()
        Check if there is sunlight in the room.
        Returns:
        The result of whether or not the room is sunny.

      • setSunny

        public void setSunny()
        Used to set rooms that will always be sunny.

      • addExit

        public void addExit(Exit ex,
           Direction dir)
        Adds the passed exit to the room in the Direction passed
        Parameters:
        ex -
        dir -

      • checkExit

        public int checkExit(Direction dir)
        Returns an int based on the status of the exit in the passed Direction. 0 = there is no exit in this direction 1 = There is a locked exit in this direction 2 = There is an unlocked exit in this direction
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction of this Area that we wish to check the status of the exit.
        Returns:
        int Returns 1 if locked and 2 otherwise.

      • removeOccupant

        public boolean removeOccupant(Character ch)
        Remove an occupant from this Area.
        Parameters:
        ch - The character that we wish to remove from the Area.
        Returns:
        True if the character was removed, false if the Area did not contain the character.

      • removeItem

        public boolean removeItem(Item i)
        Remove an item from this Area.
        Parameters:
        i - The item that we wish to remove from the Area.
        Returns:
        True if the item was removed, false if the Area did not contain the item.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription(Character character)
        Get the Description of the room. Used when Players look at the Area, or enter a new Area.
        Parameters:
        character - - The character that requested the description.
        Returns:
        The rooms description, including all items and mobs in the room.

      • getPlayers

        Returns:

        public boolean containsCharacter(Character ch)
        Check whether or not the Area has a Character.
        Parameters:
        ch - the Character that we are checking if they exist in the Area.
        Returns:
        True if the Area has the character, else false.

      • getItems

      • hasItems

        Returns:
        True if there are items, false else.

      • getAllPlayersExcept

        public java.util.Iterator<Player> getAllPlayersExcept(Character ch1,
                                             Character ch2)
        Get all of the Players inside of the room except the passed in Characters.
        Parameters:
        ch1 - Character to exclude from the Iterator.
        ch2 - Second Character to exclude from the Iterator.
        Returns:
        Iterator containing all Players inside of the Area, except ch1 and ch2.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • hasCharacter

        public Character hasCharacter(java.lang.String characterName)
        Check if an Area contains a Character.
        Parameters:
        characterName - Name of the Character to check if they are in the room or not.
        Returns:
        The Character if they are in the Area, or null if they are not.

        Parameters:
